metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: GitHub Pages lets you publish a website directly from your repository. To enable it:
content.html: GitHub Pages lets you publish a website directly from your repository. To enable it:

content.code:
git
remote
add
origin https://github.com/your-username/your-username.github.io.git

git
push -u origin master
content.code_html:
git remote add origin https://github.com/your-username/your-username.github.io.git
git push -u origin master

content.text: You can choose which branch and folder to publish. By default, GitHub uses main (or master ) and the root folder. To change this:
content.html: You can choose which branch and folder to publish. By default, GitHub uses main (or master) and the root folder. To change this:

content.text: After enabling GitHub Pages, your site will be available at https://your-username.github.io/ (or your custom domain).
content.html: After enabling GitHub Pages, your site will be available at https://your-username.github.io/ (or your custom domain).

content.text: Click the link to see your live site!
content.html: Click the link to see your live site!

content.text: To turn off your Pages site:

content.code_html: git push origin --delete gh-pages
